body.p: The Anthropic Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables developers to build secure, two-way connections between their data sources and AI-powered tools.

In the
Preferences Plugins / Oxygen AI Positron Assistant Enterprise / Model Context Protocol page you can configure a reference to a model context protocol configuration file from which AI Positron loads extra tools which can be called by the AI engine when using the chat modes or when invoking custom AI actions.

dd.p: A reference to a JSON file which configures local or remote MCP servers.

dlentry.dd: Configured timeout for attempts to connect to each server or retrieve content from it.

dlentry.dt: Add provided tools to all chat modes
dlentry.dd: Enabled by default, allows all defined chat modes to access the tools provided by the MCP servers during conversations.
Presents the status of each MCP server connection and the tools which have been retrieved from it.
